## **On-going Research Projects**
<hr style="border:1px solid black"> <!-- add black line -->


#### 1). Water demand and the value of water in the US Southeast, with [Dr. Tatiana Borisova](https://www.ers.usda.gov/authors/ers-staff-directory/tatiana-borisova), USDA-ERS


#### 2). Economics of managed aquifer recharge in the Mississippi Embayment: An integration of MODFLOW with an economic model, with [Dr. Kent Kovacs ](https://ualr.edu/cbhhs/faculty/dr-kent-kovacs/), University of Arkansas at Little Rock, [Dr. Helen E. Dahlke](https://dahlke.ucdavis.edu/about/), UC Davis, [Dr. Ahmed Ali](https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8991-5180), Irrigation and Hydraulics Department, Faculty of Engineering, Cairo University, Giza, Egypt and former postdoc at UC Davis, and [Dr. Steve Wallander](https://www.ers.usda.gov/authors/ers-staff-directory/steven-wallander), USDA-ERS


#### 3). The economic impacts of salinity intrusion on coastal rice production: a comprehensive micro-macro analysis, with Dr. Alvaro Durand-Morat (University of Arkansas at Fayetteville), Hyunwoo Kang (Oregon State University), Drs. Bradford Mills and Venkataramana Sridhar (Virginia Tech), Dr. Kieu Le (Field to Market)


#### 4). Regional supply elasticities using remote-sensing data and implications of Sustainable Groundwater Management Act (SGMA) on agricultural production in California, with Drs. Bruce Babcock & Mehdi Nemati (University of California, Riverside).


#### 5). An integrated tillage choice dynamics and biophysical modeling framework - impacts of periodic tillage on water quality in Upper Mississippi River Basin, with Lyubov A. Kurkalova (North Carolina A&T State), Jaehak Jeong (Texas A&M) & Philip W. Gassman (Iowa State University)


#### 6). Modeling field level tillage dynamics with cropland data layer (CDL): an application of Entropy approach to evaluate the effect of shifting production toward corn monoculture on farmer’s tillage choices in Iowa, with Lyubov A. Kurkalova (North Carolina A&T State) and Silvia Secchi (University of Iowa)


#### 7). Evaluating the economic potential for soil organic carbon sequestration: an integrated modeling approach, with Dr. Kieu Le (Field to Market); Dr. Olaf David (Colorado State University, Fort Collins [CSU]), Drs.
